name: Bilateral Trigeminal-Trochlear Synkinesis
chief_complaint: Involuntary eye movements with severe facial pain when chewing
symptoms: Synchronized jaw clenching with superior oblique muscle contraction
Lightning-like facial pain triggered by mastication
physical_findings: Aberrant trigeminal nerve regeneration on fMRI
Pathologic synkinetic movements between CN V and CN IV
treatment: Botulinum toxin injections to affected muscles
Stereotactic radiosurgery for aberrant nerve fibers
prognosis: Chronic condition requiring multimodal management; 30% achieve significant symptom reduction
description: A rare form of cranial nerve synkinesis where trigeminal nerve activation causes co-contraction of trochlear-innervated muscles, likely due to aberrant regeneration after pontine microhemorrhage. Presents with unique combination of neuropathic pain and ocular motility dysfunction.
